descricao: Aprenda o verbo to be no passado! Domine as formas was e were para falar sobre estados e situações no passado.

secoes.titulo: The Verb TO BE in the Past

conteudo.texto_ingles: The verb 'to be' in the past tense has only two forms: WAS and WERE. This is much simpler than the present tense which has three forms! We use past 'to be' to talk about states, conditions, and situations that existed in the past. It's essential for telling stories and describing past experiences.
conteudo.texto_portugues: O verbo 'to be' no passado tem apenas duas formas: WAS e WERE. Isso é muito mais simples que o presente que tem três formas! Usamos o 'to be' no passado para falar sobre estados, condições e situações que existiram no passado. É essencial para contar histórias e descrever experiências passadas.

secoes.descricao: Como usar WAS e WERE corretamente

itens.ingles: I was a student last year.
itens.portugues: Eu era estudante ano passado.

itens.ingles: You were very kind yesterday.
itens.portugues: Você foi muito gentil ontem.

itens.ingles: He was at home this morning.
itens.portugues: Ele estava em casa esta manhã.

itens.ingles: She was tired after work.
itens.portugues: Ela estava cansada depois do trabalho.

itens.ingles: It was a beautiful day.
itens.portugues: Foi um dia bonito.

itens.ingles: We were happy together.
itens.portugues: Nós estávamos felizes juntos.

itens.ingles: They were my classmates.
itens.portugues: Eles eram meus colegas de classe.

secoes.descricao: Regra simples para lembrar quando usar WAS ou WERE

itens.ingles: WAS: I, he, she, it (singular)
itens.portugues: WAS: Eu, ele, ela, isso (singular)
itens.contexto: WAS for all singular subjects except 'you'

itens.ingles: WERE: you, we, they (plural + you)
itens.portugues: WERE: você(s), nós, eles (plural + você)
itens.contexto: WERE for plural subjects and 'you' (even singular 'you')

itens.ingles: One person was here. / Two people were here.
itens.portugues: Uma pessoa estava aqui. / Duas pessoas estavam aqui.
itens.fonetica: /wʌn ˈpɜrsən wʌz hɪr / tu ˈpipəl wər hɪr/

secoes.titulo: Main Uses of Past TO BE
secoes.descricao: Principais usos do verbo to be no passado

itens.ingles: I was 10 years old in 2010.
itens.portugues: Eu tinha 10 anos em 2010.
itens.fonetica: /aɪ wʌz tɛn jɪrz oʊld ɪn ˈtwɛnti tɛn/

itens.ingles: She was a doctor before retirement.
itens.portugues: Ela era médica antes da aposentadoria.

itens.ingles: The weather was terrible yesterday.
itens.portugues: O tempo estava terrível ontem.

itens.ingles: We were at the beach last weekend.
itens.portugues: Nós estávamos na praia no último fim de semana.
itens.fonetica: /wi wər æt ðə bitʃ læst ˈwikˌɛnd/

itens.ingles: The movie was very interesting.
itens.portugues: O filme foi muito interessante.

itens.ingles: They were excited about the trip.
itens.portugues: Eles estavam animados com a viagem.

secoes.descricao: Expressões de tempo usadas com o verbo to be no passado

itens.ingles: I was busy yesterday.
itens.portugues: Eu estava ocupado ontem.

itens.ingles: She was here last week.
itens.portugues: Ela estava aqui na semana passada.

itens.ingles: We were students two years ago.
itens.portugues: Nós éramos estudantes há dois anos.
itens.contexto: AGO - time before now (two years ago, five minutes ago)

itens.ingles: It was cold in winter.
itens.portugues: Estava frio no inverno.
itens.contexto: IN + past time period (in 2020, in January, in winter)

itens.ingles: They were at home this morning.
itens.portugues: Eles estavam em casa esta manhã.

secoes.descricao: Como fazer perguntas com was e were

itens.ingles: Were you at school yesterday?
itens.portugues: Você estava na escola ontem?
itens.contexto: Yes/No question: move WAS/WERE to the beginning

itens.ingles: Was she happy with the result?
itens.portugues: Ela ficou feliz com o resultado?

itens.ingles: Where were you last night?
itens.portugues: Onde você estava ontem à noite?

itens.ingles: What was your favorite subject?
itens.portugues: Qual era sua matéria favorita?

itens.ingles: Who was your teacher?
itens.portugues: Quem era seu professor?

secoes.descricao: Como dar respostas curtas com was e were

itens.ingles: Were you tired? - Yes, I was. / No, I wasn't.
itens.portugues: Você estava cansado? - Sim, eu estava. / Não, eu não estava.
itens.fonetica: /wər ju ˈtaɪərd - jɛs aɪ wʌz / noʊ aɪ ˈwʌzənt/

itens.ingles: Was he at home? - Yes, he was. / No, he wasn't.
itens.portugues: Ele estava em casa? - Sim, ele estava. / Não, ele não estava.
itens.fonetica: /wʌz hi æt hoʊm - jɛs hi wʌz / noʊ hi ˈwʌzənt/

itens.ingles: Were they happy? - Yes, they were. / No, they weren't.
itens.portugues: Eles estavam felizes? - Sim, eles estavam. / Não, eles não estavam.
itens.fonetica: /wər ðeɪ ˈhæpi - jɛs ðeɪ wər / noʊ ðeɪ wərənt/

secoes.descricao: Como formar negativas com was e were

itens.ingles: I was not at work yesterday. / I wasn't at work yesterday.
itens.portugues: Eu não estava no trabalho ontem.
itens.fonetica: /aɪ wʌz nɑt æt wɜrk ˈjɛstərˌdeɪ / aɪ ˈwʌzənt æt wɜrk ˈjɛstərˌdeɪ/

itens.ingles: She was not ready for the exam. / She wasn't ready for the exam.
itens.portugues: Ela não estava pronta para a prova.
itens.fonetica: /ʃi wʌz nɑt ˈrɛdi fɔr ði ɪgˈzæm / ʃi ˈwʌzənt ˈrɛdi fɔr ði ɪgˈzæm/

itens.ingles: We were not late. / We weren't late.
itens.portugues: Nós não estávamos atrasados.
itens.fonetica: /wi wər nɑt leɪt / wi wərənt leɪt/

itens.ingles: They were not satisfied with the service. / They weren't satisfied.
itens.portugues: Eles não estavam satisfeitos com o serviço.
itens.fonetica: /ðeɪ wər nɑt ˈsætəsˌfaɪd wɪð ðə ˈsɜrvəs / ðeɪ wərənt ˈsætəsˌfaɪd/

secoes.descricao: Como usar there was e there were

itens.ingles: There was a party last night.
itens.portugues: Houve uma festa ontem à noite.

itens.ingles: There were many people at the concert.
itens.portugues: Havia muitas pessoas no concerto.
itens.fonetica: /ðɛr wər ˈmɛni ˈpipəl æt ðə ˈkɑnsərt/

itens.ingles: There was a problem with my computer.
itens.portugues: Havia um problema com meu computador.
itens.fonetica: /ðɛr wʌz ə ˈprɑbləm wɪð maɪ kəmˈpjutər/

itens.ingles: There weren't any tickets available.
itens.portugues: Não havia ingressos disponíveis.

itens.ingles: Was there a meeting yesterday?
itens.portugues: Houve uma reunião ontem?

secoes.descricao: Comparando o verbo to be no presente e passado

itens.ingles: I am happy now. / I was happy yesterday.
itens.portugues: Eu estou feliz agora. / Eu estava feliz ontem.
itens.fonetica: /aɪ æm ˈhæpi naʊ / aɪ wʌz ˈhæpi ˈjɛstərˌdeɪ/

itens.ingles: She is a teacher. / She was a student.
itens.portugues: Ela é professora. / Ela era estudante.
itens.fonetica: /ʃi ɪz ə ˈtitʃər / ʃi wʌz ə ˈstudənt/

itens.ingles: We are at home. / We were at school.
itens.portugues: Nós estamos em casa. / Nós estávamos na escola.
itens.fonetica: /wi ɑr æt hoʊm / wi wər æt skul/

secoes.titulo: Real Life Dialogue - Talking About the Past
secoes.descricao: Conversa real usando o verbo to be no passado

conversas.ingles: Hi Carlos! How was your weekend?
conversas.portugues: Oi Carlos! Como foi seu fim de semana?

conversas.ingles: It was great! I was at my grandmother's house. The weather was perfect.
conversas.portugues: Foi ótimo! Eu estava na casa da minha avó. O tempo estava perfeito.
conversas.fonetica: /ɪt wʌz greɪt aɪ wʌz æt maɪ ˈgrænˌmʌðərz haʊs ðə ˈwɛðər wʌz ˈpɜrfɪkt/

conversas.ingles: That sounds nice! Were your cousins there too?
conversas.portugues: Isso parece legal! Seus primos estavam lá também?
conversas.fonetica: /ðæt saʊndz naɪs wər jʊr ˈkʌzənz ðɛr tu/

conversas.ingles: Yes, they were! We were all together for my grandmother's birthday. She was so happy!
conversas.portugues: Sim, estavam! Estávamos todos juntos para o aniversário da minha avó. Ela ficou tão feliz!
conversas.fonetica: /jɛs ðeɪ wər wi wər ɔl təˈgɛðər fɔr maɪ ˈgrænˌmʌðərz ˈbɜrθˌdeɪ ʃi wʌz soʊ ˈhæpi/

conversas.ingles: She was 80! There was a big party with all the family. It was wonderful to see everyone.
conversas.portugues: Ela fez 80! Houve uma grande festa com toda a família. Foi maravilhoso ver todo mundo.
conversas.fonetica: /ʃi wʌz ˈeɪti ðɛr wʌz ə bɪg ˈpɑrti wɪð ɔl ðə ˈfæməli ɪt wʌz ˈwʌndərfəl tu si ˈɛvriˌwʌn/

conversas.ingles: That's beautiful! I wasn't with my family last weekend. I was working on a project.
conversas.portugues: Isso é lindo! Eu não estava com minha família no último fim de semana. Eu estava trabalhando num projeto.
conversas.fonetica: /ðæts ˈbjutəfəl aɪ ˈwʌzənt wɪð maɪ ˈfæməli læst ˈwikˌɛnd aɪ wʌz ˈwɜrkɪŋ ɑn ə ˈprɑdʒɛkt/

conteudo.texto_ingles: When I was a child, life was very different. I was always excited about simple things. My family wasn't rich, but we were happy together. My father was a mechanic and my mother was a teacher at the local school. We were living in a small town where everyone knew each other. There were only two main streets and one small park in the center. The park was our favorite place to play. There was an old tree where we used to sit and read books. My best friend was my neighbor Tom. He was the same age as me, and we were inseparable. We weren't interested in video games because there weren't many around at that time. Instead, we were always outside, playing soccer or riding our bicycles. The summers were long and hot, and we were constantly swimming in the river behind our house. My grandmother was living with us, and she was the best cook in the world. Her kitchen was always full of delicious smells. Those were the happiest days of my life. Everything was simple, but we were content with what we had.
conteudo.texto_portugues: Quando eu era criança, a vida era muito diferente. Eu estava sempre animado com coisas simples. Minha família não era rica, mas éramos felizes juntos. Meu pai era mecânico e minha mãe era professora na escola local. Estávamos morando numa cidade pequena onde todo mundo se conhecia. Havia apenas duas ruas principais e um pequeno parque no centro. O parque era nosso lugar favorito para brincar. Havia uma árvore velha onde costumávamos sentar e ler livros. Meu melhor amigo era meu vizinho Tom. Ele tinha a mesma idade que eu, e éramos inseparáveis. Não estávamos interessados em videogames porque não havia muitos naquela época. Em vez disso, estávamos sempre lá fora, jogando futebol ou andando de bicicleta. Os verões eram longos e quentes, e estávamos constantemente nadando no rio atrás da nossa casa. Minha avó estava morando conosco, e ela era a melhor cozinheira do mundo. A cozinha dela estava sempre cheia de cheiros deliciosos. Aqueles foram os dias mais felizes da minha vida. Tudo era simples, mas estávamos contentes com o que tínhamos.

secoes.titulo: Essential Tips for Past TO BE

conteudo.texto_ingles: Remember these key points: 1) Only two forms: WAS (I, he, she, it) and WERE (you, we, they). 2) 'You' always takes WERE, even when talking to one person. 3) Use past time expressions: yesterday, last week, ago, in 2020. 4) For questions, move WAS/WERE to the front. 5) Contractions: wasn't, weren't (more common than full forms). 6) THERE WAS (singular) vs THERE WERE (plural). 7) Past TO BE describes states and conditions, not actions.
conteudo.texto_portugues: Lembre-se desses pontos-chave: 1) Apenas duas formas: WAS (I, he, she, it) e WERE (you, we, they). 2) 'You' sempre leva WERE, mesmo falando com uma pessoa. 3) Use expressões de tempo passado: yesterday, last week, ago, in 2020. 4) Para perguntas, mova WAS/WERE para frente. 5) Contrações: wasn't, weren't (mais comuns que formas completas). 6) THERE WAS (singular) vs THERE WERE (plural). 7) TO BE no passado descreve estados e condições, não ações.

conteudo.texto_ingles: Now practice! Talk about your past: Where were you born? What was your first school like? Who was your best friend as a child? Create questions using WAS/WERE and practice answering them. Describe how things were different in the past compared to now. Tell a story about a memorable day using past TO BE. Remember: WAS and WERE are the foundation for talking about the past in English!
conteudo.texto_portugues: Agora pratique! Fale sobre seu passado: Onde você nasceu? Como era sua primeira escola? Quem era seu melhor amigo quando criança? Crie perguntas usando WAS/WERE e pratique respondê-las. Descreva como as coisas eram diferentes no passado comparado a agora. Conte uma história sobre um dia memorável usando TO BE no passado. Lembre-se: WAS e WERE são a base para falar sobre o passado em inglês!
